intro: Trifolium radiosum, commonly known as common clover, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets arranged on a single stalk. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed areas. Trifolium radiosum is a member of the legume family and has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, enriching the soil.
